page.title: 02Linkwood Farm.
page.content: Linkwood farm is part of the large Linkwood Estate which covers 1300 acres. Mr Robertson being the manager of Linkwood Estate,has a large responsibility. Linkwood has three herds of cattle, each having 160 cows. The cows can produce up to 3000 litres of milk a day. In 1984 Linkwood Farm had to cull 20 cows because of the EEC milk Quotas. The EEC stated that there was to be a 9% cut back on milk. Linkwood Farm grows barley, wheat, turnips, oil seed rape, potatoes and peas. At harvest time they cut the barley and take in the same day. They do this because children have been known to make huts in the bales, then light a fire which could easily cause a fatal accident.
